10 minutes ago, nascarlaser1 said:

Plenty of console players have bought minecraft, which is often full of bugs (that's why people invented bug updates), yet you say console player buys game, and expects it to work right away. How does that make any sense, or even possible???

Does it make sense to buy a product expecting a defective one?

Minecraft, at least, didn't notoriously corrupt your saves on its first console release.

Buying the first iteration of anything is pretty daring, be it car, software, whatever- some people get that there will be recalls/issues and do it anyway. Others will hang out a bit and wait for the kinks to get worked out. I recommend being the second kind of person.

Moo?

I don't have the console version, but I'm under the impression that the console version has a nasty bug that corrupts all your KSP save files. Given the walled-garden approach of consoles, it's not like you can backup your saves to zip file or a usb-stick, so this is not something that can be mitigated, and in my book anything that forces you to restart a career you invested dozens, if not hundreds, of hours in, seems pretty game-breaking in my book.

People are not expecting a bug free version. Heck, the “base” version of the game isn't bug free, it would be foolish to expect the console version to be superior in that respect. Of course there's the nasty aspect that some (wheel/gear) bugs are now mitigated through mods, something you can't do on the console, but the lack of mods was known upfront. And while every game has bugs, the kind of bugs that render your all your saves unplayable would get a... special kind of attention if Bethesda, Rockstar, Activision or any of the other large publisher would pull of a stunt like that.

Guess Squad should just quit working. They made one bad first initial release into a market they've never ventured into before. Not to mention new console and platforms. 

Ah well. They tried but they failed so they're attempts don't matter. Years of work worthless. 

Guess they can't redeem themselves for one failure which honestly was to be expected as again they've never worked with it before.

Ah well guys. At least we enjoyed KSP while it lasted... Oh wait according to you we didn't. 

Baaaa.

I think @ZooNamedGames has just answered this discussion nicely.

I have had to delete my saved data for KSP on Xbox One twice now. It is to the point where I am not really interested in playing anymore. Such a great feeling when you dock to your first space station, only to realize that no matter how many times you do this, the game will not save your progress. In fact, doing anything worthwhile is seemingly impossible right now, whether that be long journeys, putting satellites into orbit, building space stations, or a moon base. I haven't been able to play basically since launch because I know anything I do is just a waste of time. I was under the impression that I was buying a finished game, not a work in progress. If they wanted to, they could have released into the Xbox Preview Program, where they could have had all the time to iron out all the bugs and glitches.
